001package imagingbook.pub.corners.subpixel_obsolete;
002
003import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
004import imagingbook.lib.settings.PrintPrecision;
005
006/**
007 * 2D interpolator based on fitting a quadratic polynomial (parabolic function) to the supplied samples.
008 * Samples s0,...,s8 must be arranged in the following order:
009 * <pre>
010 *    s4 s3 s2
011 *    s5 s0 s1
012 *    s6 s7 s8 </pre>
013 * Only 5 of the 9 supplied sample values are used (the corner samples are ignored).
014 * @author WB
015 * @version 2020/09/29
016 * @deprecated
017 */
018public class ParabolicInterpolator2D implements PolynomialInterpolator2D {
019        
020        private final double[] c;       // polynomial coefficients
021        
022        public ParabolicInterpolator2D(float[] s) {
023                c = new double[5];
024                c[0] = s[0];
025                c[1] = (s[1] - s[5]) / 2;
026                c[2] = (s[7] - s[3]) / 2;
027                c[3] = (s[1] - 2 * s[0] + s[5]) / 2;
028                c[4] = (s[3] - 2 * s[0] + s[7]) / 2;
029                // TODO: check for zero values of c[3], c[4]
030        }
031        
032        // ---------------------------------------------------------
033
034        @Override
035        public double[] getCoefficients() {
036                return c;
037        }
038
039        @Override
040        public double[] getGradient(double x, double y) {
041                double gx = c[1] + 2 * c[3] * x;
042                double gy = c[2] + 2 * c[4] * y;
043                return new double[] {gx, gy};
044        }
045
046        @Override
047        public double[][] getHessian(double x, double y) {
048                double[][] H = {
049                                {2 * c[3], 0}, 
050                                {0, 2 * c[4]}
051                                };
052                return H;
053        }
054        
055        @Override
056        public float getInterpolatedValue(double x, double y) {
057                return (float) (c[0] + c[1] * x + c[2] * y + c[3] * x * x + c[4] * y * y);
058        }
059
060        @Override
061        public float[] getMaxPosition() {
062                float xMax = (float) (-0.5 * c[1] / c[3]);
063                float yMax = (float) (-0.5 * c[2] / c[4]);
064                return new float[] {xMax, yMax};
065        }
066        
067        // ---------------------------------------------------------
068
069        public static void main(String[] args) {
070                PrintPrecision.set(5);
071                float[] samples = {16,9,7,11,8,15,14,12,10}; // = s_0,...,s_8
072                ParabolicInterpolator2D interp = new ParabolicInterpolator2D(samples);
073                
074                System.out.println(ParabolicInterpolator2D.class.getName());
075                System.out.println("c = " + Matrix.toString(interp.getCoefficients()));
076                
077                double[][] iVals = new double[3][3];
078                for (int v = -1; v <= 1; v++) {
079                        for (int u = -1; u <= 1; u++) {
080                                iVals[v+1][u+1] = interp.getInterpolatedValue(u, v);
081                        }
082                }
083                System.out.println("iVals = " + Matrix.toString(iVals));
084                
085                double[] g = interp.getGradient(0, 0);
086                System.out.println("g(0,0) = " + Matrix.toString(g));
087                System.out.println("H(0,0) = " + Matrix.toString(interp.getHessian(0, 0)));
088                
089                float[] pMax = interp.getMaxPosition();
090                System.out.println("pMax = " + Matrix.toString(interp.getMaxPosition()));
091                System.out.println("vMax = " + interp.getInterpolatedValue(pMax[0], pMax[1]));
092
093        }
094}
